headline: Easy Garam Masala
description: This garam masala recipe produces a quick and easy version of the aromatic blend of spices that add a delicious flavor and warmth to Indian dishes.

video.description: See how to make your own Indian spice blend at home.
video.name: Easy Garam Masala

name: Easy Garam Masala

recipeInstructions.text: Mix cumin, coriander, cardamom, pepper, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg in a bowl.
Place mix in an airtight container, and store in a cool, dry place.

review.reviewBody: I like it but plan to try out a few different recipes to compare. It may be a little cardamom heavy but it was great flavor in my vegan Saag dish! Thanks!
Great recipe, ingenious, misterious, yet easy to make.
This is marvelous! I made dal this evening with this garam masala. Delicious.
Great recipe better than store bought.
I don’t know what is authentic. Tried many masala mix before, this is by far the nicest.

Garam Masala is so good in so many dishes. I make a big batch and use it frequently. I love Turmeric and added an equal portion as the other main spices. The flavor and color are better with that addition.
It was fantastic combination of spices and we loved it. We used the Spices we bought from trupery.com that was really fresh and authentic. Once again thanks for sharing this recipe..
This is sooo good, thanks for sharing
The only thing missing from the spices is the fennel and the star anise. I ground up one pod and one teaspoon of fennel and added it to this recipe. It adds a ton more flavor.
Very nice . I made it.

I used it for a Keema recipe that was posted in AllRecipes. Since I didn't have any at home, I had all of the spices already in the cupboard to make the Keema recipe I found. 
Very authentic! Now that I know that the spices are roasted first then ground, I will probably do that for now on as I have them whole as well.
This is a pretty good recipe. I like to add ground ginger to it hence the 4 stars. Otherwise, this is just what you need when you can't find it in stores anymore!
I ran out of my bottle of this spice for a vegan curry. Thank u for this spice blend, it was perfect!
Made it really quick. Smelled great.
Wonderful mix! I make it every time that I make an Indian dish.
i make this now and again to have on hand when i make indian food. it is a good blend, nice balance of flavors.
I double each ingredient. kept it in the fridge. used it with my lamb, chicken and fish and lentils and soup recipes. My coworker thought I brought a dish from an Ethiopian restaurant.
Good basic seasoning recipe. I'm also looking to kick up the flavor but this works well as a starter.

I realized I was out of garam masala after I had already started sautéing the aromatics for my dal, so this recipe was perfect in a pinch! Since it uses pre-ground spices, you can mix it up quickly without having to worry about toasting and grinding each spice.
Delicious as is in Lamb Korma.

I don't know enough about garam masala to say whether this is authentic or not. However, in the dish that I used it in, it was delicious. Excellent flavor. My only concern was that I used this spice which already had cumin in it. My recipe called for an addition of cumin. I thought it strange since this recipe already had it as an ingredient. I did not affect the taste though. And I saved it in a jar for later use.

Even though I’m a rookie to Indian food, I made my own garam masala from this recipe to go into another recipe - I was nervous about cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg because my American palette associates that stuff with sweets, but I found this mixture very tasty and the the cinnamon, nutmeg and clove flavors made sense in the curry dish I put it in... Cool!
Will definitely make again. It's hard to buy in my area.
This was so easy, and yes whole seeds are better, but when you run out of Garam Masala, this is a lifesaver! Thank you for this recipe!
Great spice blend. I didn't have coriander, so I substituted curry powder instead, since the first ingredient is coriander.
Easy to make and has a very strong aromatic scent. Can’t wait to try it tonight!
Simple and easy and very flavorful
great in indian food!
What a help to find this! Couldn’t find garam masala in my local grocery store and it’s an important ingredient in Indian recipes. Now I have it whenever I want. Thank you.
Easy and worked great in my cashew chicken recipe
perfect had everything at home so no need to buy anything. Thanks!!
really informative - thank you
One of the things I don't like is a lot of cinnamon in savory cooking so I halved the amount.
Easy and authentic
Perfect!
I've made it as is, and I've made it with 1/4 t. of ground ginger, too. The ginger is entirely up to you and your preferences, but I like it.
Perfect!
I made it, excluding the cardamom (personal preference), and it was DELICIOUS! It was perfect with my Chicken Tikka Masala!
I always have some Garam Masala blend in my spice rack to kick up a spice rub for pork or chicken or to use in indian dishes. Versatile and yummy!
Very Good and easy to make.

Making my fourth triple batch! Easy as the name says. The biggest problem was initially finding all of the ingredients but now have enough for many batches. I would recommend grinding the whole ingredients outside after dry roasting. My husband had a respiratory issue and grinding the mix inside aggravated his condition.
Love this receipe!
make it fresh each time we make tikka masala. missing the fresh roasted flavor though.
Made exactly as written and it’s great with many uses.
Love this recipe
I didn't make any changes. I'm so happy to have a garam masala that tastes great. Not like the nasty packaged mixes.

Love this recipe. Have made it twice and doubled the second time I made it and keep it in a small mason jar. Taste great on roasts, chicken, lamb and just about anything. I do occasionally sprinkle in a bit of cayenne for a bit of heat. Everyone loves when I make a roast with this seasoning.
Delicious. I used it in a Chicken Markhani recipe that turned out very tasty.
I used it in vegetable soup and it was delicious. I had all the ground spices on hand and now I have my own garam marsala mix to use for future recipes! I'm very pleased.

I love this recipe. The scent is bold and makes my mouth water for Indian food. The flavor is full. I use it in many recipes. It tastes great as a spice over baked sweet potatoes and a sprinkle of olive oil.
Easy peasy. I toasted the spices after mixing to release some fragrance
Love it with pop corn
No stores around here so I made my own.
I love how easy this is, and it’s tasted great every time I’ve used it.
I used a mix of pre-ground and whole spices that I ground. What I had in my cupboard.
Used it for a tikka masala recipe and it turned out great!
Not quite as good as toasting whole spices and doing this the "real" way, but an easy substitute for the pre-ground masala mixes at the store.
I've bought store masala mixes in the past and they pale in comparison to this recipe. Love it!

If taste is king, then this recipe needs adjustment.
First of all, no cloves (it's perfum).
Second, use 1 green and 2 black cardamom pods not 1.5 teaspoons worth, the black ones are smoky, green more perfumy hence the former.
Lastly use 3/8 teaspoon nutmeg and 1/8 mace.

Because one of the ingredients is cinnamon, its recommended to add the garam masala at the end of cook time.
Just used this in some Aloo Gobi - Awesome!

Thank you, whoever contributed this recipe! I didn't have any garam masala and wanted to make dinner tonight. I had all of these spices, and whipped this up in no time. I also toasted them in a dry skillet for a little first. This was so incredibly delicious and flavorful, AND it cost me nothing! They wanted $5 for a tiny jar of this at my local market. This will be a staple in my household.
Our family mixed this recipe up to use as spice for a meal, and it worked perfectly.
this is a quick and easy great tasting seasoning. add to almost anything to make it more savory

This taste amazing! I used the same salt amount in the marinade, and cut the salt by a two thirds in the Marsala sauce.. I made naan bread with it (from scratch) , and it was a hit in my house full of picky eaters!! Even my 3 yr old ate it!! Yay!! Success!!
toasting the spices smells amazing! it tastes like the perfect blend of spices, smokey, sweet, and savory
In my opinion, this blend did not have enough of what I call the "perfumey" spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves.

I needed garam masala in order to make Red Curry Chicken Chili from this site so I made my own. I didn't have cardamom, so I left it out; and I did have star anise pods, so I put them in, because I thought they'd be fun. And they were. Nice combination of flavors. Yum. Thank you!
Next time leave out pepper.
I just made my 2nd batch - very good

This worked just perfect for my butter chicken recipe that calls for garam masala. I could not taste much of a difference between this and the Suraj brand I normally buy. Makes enough to add to your spice rack and then some. I substituted ground parsley flakes for the coriander I didn't have.
Easy to make and use, adds wonderful flavours to any Indian dish.

This is a warming spice. I added New Mexico chile, mustard, and turmeric . I also tripled the amount of coriander and increased most spices to get the right blend. 

I have not seen a Garam Masala mix without chile before.
I accidentally put an half tsp more cinnamon. But it smells marvelous.
I couldn't find this at my local grocer, so I made my own. I made a double batch and use it for my butter chicken recipe!
Love this all purpose spice blend. I use it in a variety of other dishes besides the Indian recipe I found on this site.
I can't find it at my local grocery store and this has worked in every recipe that has called for it.
This recipe is very good. First time having it and like all of the spices. It works well alone and with other flavors in dishes.

I made this and it was AWESOME. I really liked the cinnamon. If I make another batch, I'll go heavier on the cinnamon and clove just for personal preference but it was just the right ending to the Chicken Curry I made. This recipe made my chicken curry go from great to AWESOME!
This did not have the intense flavor that I so often enjoyed at Indian restaurants.
Added 1/2 tsp of tumeric and 1/2 tsp ground mustard (trying to match look and smell of one I bought at an Indian market). I think I'll be using this from now on :-)
Very good, Glad it didn't ask for lots of salt.
mild
Ground my pepper and cloves. Smelled divine and tasted great.

Cardamom is extremely expensive so I used nutmeg and cinnamon to sub. 

This is an amazing Garam Masala and I will be using only this recipe for the rest of my life! Thank you Thank you Thank you!
EASY! Cheaper than a store bought mix...Can be tweaked to suit personal taste.
I'm just starting to experiment with curries and this recipe is fantastic. I don't have any indian market where I live, so this has been a life saver when a recipe calls for it.

Making Keema Aloo (recipe on here - The Meatetarian, recipe author). That recipe called for garam masala, but I didn't have any. A search on Allrecipes and I find this one! It's my go-to garam masala spice mix. :D
the best Garam Masala recipe !!!! very easy to make and packs a great flavor.
Smells great!!
Perfect. Used it for samosas. Place smells fantastic now.

I love this recipe! I bought a bottle of garam masala and it was ok but I could tell the difference between that and home made. This recipe tastes awesome! I made it in bangain bharta and also a potato and peas dish. Fantastic!

I was making an Indian dish and had no garam masala. I found this recipe and did as many others. In my case, I added all the spices whether ground or whole and roasted them very quickly in my pan, then I ground it all up in the coffee grinder. I liked this recipe very much and it was much easier than going to go buy garam masala at a specialty store. I recommend this recipe!
i can't believe i've never rated this.. i use this recipe often, whenever anything calls for garam masala.. i usually have all the ingredients on hand.. this works beautifully.. ty for the recipe
Loved this recipe. I live in a remote area in the western USA and can't just buy Garam Masala at the market. This is the best/easiest recipe I've found.

Absolutely delicious. I have never had garam masala from a store. But I used this recipe to make Chicken Tikka Masala after having it in a restaurant, and my homemade version comes out amazing every time with this spice recipe.

Really tasty and smells so good as the dish you use it in is cooking! .I used this with a Weight Watchers recipe for Spiced Roasted Butternut Squash. It was delicious!! I especially appreciated the recipe because my husband is allergic to coriander, so I was able to leave that out.
Excellent. Followed "Gitana" steps.
Very easy to make, but im not a fan of it. Seems abit like chinese five spice.
Excellent mix!
Nice and simple. I'm new to cooking. I'm allergic to wheat and have to start Learning to be a"chef." Well, I wouldn't say that. :-)
